brief_summary.textblock:
The study is aimed to develop a new reaction-time based method for examining the visual
      field and to study the effect of refractive error on the magnification of a fundus
      photograph in order to evaluate the true size of a retinal feature.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Determine the Location of the Blind Spot and the Macula-disc Centre Distance on a Fundus Photograph
clinical_study.condition: Generalized Visual Field Contraction or Constriction

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  No disease that effect the fundus photograph or visual field

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  any disease that effects the fundus photograph or visual field

clinical_study.official_title: A Study to Develop Both a Novel Method for Evaluating the True Size of a Retinal Object on Fundus Photographs and a New Reaction-time Based Method for Studying the Visual Field on Healthy Volunteers

primary_outcome.description: Measurement is done on a fundus photograph (one visit and one examination for each patient)
primary_outcome.time_frame: one measurement at the start of the study

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: The location of the blind spot is screened using Octopus custom made visual field program at the one visit (one visit and one study for each patient) and a novel reaction-time based visual field device.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: one measurement at the start of the study

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional
